Dating: EARLY DYNASTIC PERIOD/THINITE PERIOD (not before); 1ST DYNASTY ?; EARLY DYNASTIC PERIOD/THINITE PERIOD (not after)
Name: Vase of stone
Description: This porphyry vase, found in the tomb of Hor-Aha, one of the first kings of Egypt, is a beautiful example of the high level of craftsmanship that Egyptian artists achieved. Despite its narrow neck and asymmetrical shape, the receptacle has been carefully hollowed out and all traces of drilling erased. Similar objects in pottery were used as water jugs.
